授業目的:
This course continues the learning from Reading IA with a focus on the following goals:
To learn how articles are organized, recognize main ideas of a reading, and understand how main ideas are supported by surrounding sentences/passages.
To read without depending on Japanese translations.
到達目標:
1. Through intensive reading, students will improve basic reading comprehension skills required to understand descriptive, explanatory, and problem-solving passages.
2. Students will build vocabulary through learning words and expressions used in the textbooks.
3. Students will read extensively to improve reading fluency. Graded readers (books written in simple English) will be used if the course meets in person. If not, we will use the website Breaking News English.
授業方法:
1. English is used in class.
2. Preparation before the class is essential.
3. Occasional workshops are conducted
If online learning is scheduled, the course format will be changed. Please follow your teacher’s instruction.

トピック.授業計画1:
Overview for each class:
A detailed Course Outline including weekly activities and assessments will be proved at the beginning of the semester. Basically, students will do the following activities:
1. Weekly reading practice and vocabulary learning by using the textbook.
2. Extensive reading (outside class) 5 times per semester (online learning may have a different way. Please follow your teacher’s instruction).
3. Occasional vocabulary tests, and two examinations during the semester.
4. Occasional homework to be brought into class in the following week (this does not apply to online learning. Weekly activities should be followed).
トピック.授業外学習2:
Study required outside class:
1. Students are requested to prepare for each lesson as instructed in the Course Outline.
2. Students are requested to read 5 Graded Readers books, and submit their reports (or equivalent reading in the case of online learning)
